intro: Conradia corrugata, commonly known as the roughleaf conradia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically rough to the touch, giving it its common name. Conradia corrugata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
